raw_comment:
I notice that we have added no meaningful nuclear capacity in the last quarter century despite it being an incredibly easy fix for both massive power generation needs and essentially zero carbon emissions. And there is a class of "environmentalist" that actually fights FOR that outcome. And we can thank them for the concomittant absolute (if not percentage) rise in coal and other fossil fuels to meet growing energy demand.

Solar is great, but nuclear is a magic bullet that's been around for decades and has only improved since. We are being foolish.
ace_sentences: In the last 25 years, we have added no meaningful nuclear capacity.
Nuclear power is an easy fix for massive power generation needs.
Nuclear power has essentially zero carbon emissions.
Some environmentalists fight for the outcome that no meaningful nuclear capacity is added.
Coal and other fossil fuels have risen in absolute terms to meet growing energy demand.
The rise in coal and other fossil fuels is concomitant with the lack of meaningful nuclear capacity.
Nuclear power is a magic bullet.
Nuclear power has existed for decades.
Nuclear power has improved since it existed.
